part.narration: Yuki, sitting at a wooden desk in front of a patterned wall behind a heightened boom-mic, straightens her papers. At the bottom of the screen reads, "Candidate Interview." Yuki looks at the camera and says:
part.line: My name is Yuki Takeshi and I am illiterate.
I dropped out of college.
I am in a same-sex marriage.
I am an orphan.
I hallucinate around people.
I only got hired to lead a company for shits and giggles as they die.
part.narration: NoLifeQueen flips up the "desk" and kicks down the "wall" and throws away the "boom-mic." NoLifeQueen looks at the camera and says:
part.line: Her name is Yuki Takeshi and she's just foreign!
She's just a misunderstood genius!
She's just experimenting!
She's just in a tussle with her mom!
She just has a personality disorder! She's not alone!
She was hired because she's a great game designer!
part.narration: Across the cheek, Yuki slaps NoLifeQueen.
part.line: Who is a great game designer?
part.narration: Yuki punches NoLifeQueen in the stomach.

NoLifeQueen whirls and winces and collapses. Yuki looks behind her. Deep in a valley, stacked upon each other, are millions of multi-colored blocks, divided into groups of four — tetrominos — a mine of them.
part.line: Just a bit further to the Other Side!
The grass better be greener here.
I promise, it will be different!
part.narration: The two men slide down the black-gravel hill. Yuki follows.The Moscow Tetromino Mine is more of an exploratory area. Tons of places to go, people to do, things to see, and only two people from Yuki's Real Life. Well elaborate to the Player that this place is different.

Yuki makes it down the hill. Into this mount of nature-shined four-blocks is carved a beautiful town of people unlike any seen before. The two men stride and gaze upon the unblemished blocks. One raises his arms to the blocks and heavens.
part.line: Look at this. I bet the structures these make would be perfect to any architect.
Deep to any philosopher.
Worthy of any king.
Engaging to any common man.
Come, Gerasimov. We have plans to make.

choice.comment: The Player did not hire Kenneth Anderson.

condition.line: Shoot, that's why I left my home-land — I was tired of seeing it.
You mean — you weren't forced to leave?
But I'm living the Japanese Dream, damn it —
Imagine, immigration for the sake of not Famine nor Union nor Huguenot —
But for indulgence, for leisure, for pure desire!
Or in protest of some petty law.

condition.narration: Yuki finds Capucine Rousseau. Capucine, devoid of her usual watch and unheard of her usual yawn, dances in circles and waves her arms.
Yuki watches her continue her unrestrained twirls.
condition.line: What's beautiful? Not that I despise this place, but what is here to love?
